column4: what happens if you type: echo > testfile         in a terminal?
Read-only file system....It was fine a few days ago!
boot to a live disk, and run fsck -f /dev/XXXX on the partition in question, as root. Do NOT mount the partition. Typically XXXX will be /dev/sda1  but use mount or df -T to be sure.
read llutz post, and execute that. Thanks llutz.
